title: GIS Emergency Model
description: GIS Emergency management workflow for the second version of the workflow engine.
subject: gis
simple
health
creator: OGSE workflow engine

title: Emergency area
creator: Bruno St-Aubin
description: This atomic model periodically generates emergencies. It can also receive rejected emergencies to accumulate them and generate statistics.
subject: health
gis
simple
behavior: Every 24 hours, a random number of emergencies are generated by a geographic area. The number of emergencies is proportional to the population count of the area and uses a random factor for variance. Emergencies are first sent through the 1st of 3 ports. If it is rejected, then it is sent to the 2nd port and 3rd port.

state.description: This model tracks the number of dead inhabitants due to being rejected by all 3 ports.

field.name: dead
field.description: Number of deaths due to rejected emergencies.

field.name: area_id
field.description: The unique identifier of the area that generated the emergency.

field.name: port_i
field.description: The origin port through which this emergency was sent.

field.name: quantity
field.description: Number of persons for this emergency.

title: Hospital
creator: Bruno St-Aubin
description: This atomic model receives emergencies and processes them if it has capacity otherwise, it rejects them.
subject: health
gis
simple
behavior:
Every 24 hours, it processes a number of emergencies according to the hospital rate.
If the number of active emergencies in the hospital exceeds its capacity, it rejects them.

state.description: This model tracks the number of active, total, released and rejected emergencies.

field.name: active
field.description: Number of emergencies currently being processed at the hospital.

field.name: total
field.description: Total number of emergencies processed and rejected at the hospital.

field.name: released
field.description: Number of released emergencies at the hospital due to being processed successfully.

field.name: rejected
field.description: Number of rejected emergencies at the hospital due to being over capacity.

field.name: area_id
field.description: The unique identifier of the area that generated the emergency.

field.name: port_i
field.description: The origin port through which this emergency was sent.

field.name: quantity
field.description: Number of persons for this emergency.
